content.description:
The following graph shows data from an experiment in which <math alttext="N O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> decomposes as represented by the equation.

<math alttext="N O 2, gas, reacts to produce N O, gas, plus one half O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>NO</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>g</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> <mo>â†’</mo> <mi>NO</mi> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>g</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>g</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </math>
content.question: The graph could be used to support which of the following statements?

choices.label: The half-life of the reaction is constant.
The magnitude of the rate constant, <math alttext="k" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math>, is approximately <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn></math>.

The unit of the rate constant, <math alttext="k" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math>, is <math alttext="inverse seconds" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mpadded></msup></math>.

The rate law for the reaction is <math alttext="rate equals k times the molar concentration of N O 2, squared" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><msup><mpadded><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msup></math>.

content.answer: The rate law for the reaction is <math alttext="rate equals k times the molar concentration of N O 2, squared" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><msup><mpadded><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msup></math>.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from experimental data.
